p: Of the 31 countries surveyed, 14 (45%) reported availability of seasonal influenza vaccine (Figure 1); six in the private sector only (Democratic Republic of Congo, Senegal, Togo, Uganda, Zambia, and Zimbabwe) and eight in both private and public sectors (Cameroon, Côte d’Ivoire, Egypt, Kenya, Madagascar, Mauritius, Morocco, and South Africa) (Table 1). Moreover, although we were not able to find anyone to respond to this survey in Algeria, WHO reports influenza vaccine is available there [ 14]. La Réunion also reported availability of vaccine in both the private and public sectors.
